Amazons

Double Yellow-headed Amazon

A large, popular Amazon known for its striking yellow head, which spreads down the neck as it matures. They are highly sought after for their talking and singing ability.

Origin
Central & South America
Size
15-17 inches (38-43 cm). Weight: 480-600g (17-21 oz)
Weight
540g avg.
Noise Level
Very Loud. Possess an extremely powerful voice and are not shy about using it.

Looking for a Double Yellow-headed Amazon?

See Available Double Yellow-headed Amazon Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 7/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Highly intelligent, social, and confident. Can be very affectionate but are prone to bonding strongly with one person and can become aggressive, especially during breeding season.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Among the best talkers in the parrot world, capable of amazing clarity and extensive vocabularies. They are also talented singers.

Dietary Needs

Prone to obesity. A low-fat pelleted diet is crucial, supplemented with a wide variety of vegetables. Fruit and nuts should be given sparingly.

Health & Lifespan

Can live for 60+ years. Susceptible to obesity, fatty liver disease, atherosclerosis, and upper respiratory infections.

Housing Requirements

Needs a very large and durable cage due to their size and beak strength. Not suitable for apartments. Minimum cage: 40"W x 30"D x 60"H.

Common Questions About Double Yellow-headed Amazon

What is the lifespan of a Double Yellow-headed Amazon?

The Double Yellow-headed Amazon typically lives for 60+ years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Double Yellow-headed Amazon good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Double Yellow-headed Amazon come from?

The Double Yellow-headed Amazon is native to Central & South America.

More Amazons

Blue-fronted Amazon

Loud. While maybe not as intense as the Yellow-naped, they can and will scream to get attention or express excitement.

Green-cheeked Amazon

Loud. They have a high-pitched, loud call.

Lilac-crowned Amazon

Moderate. While capable of loud calls, they are not as prone to screaming as some of their relatives.
